channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: PiEEG-16 to Measure 16 EEG Channels with Raspberry Pi for Brain-Computer Interfaces and EEG devices
item.description: This article introduces a cost-effective gateway into the fascinating world of neuroscience: the PIEEG-16, a versatile shield for RaspberryPi designed to measure 16 channels of various biosignals, including EEG (electroencephalography), EMG (electromyography), and ECG (electrocardiography) without any data transfer over the network (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth) and processing and feature ectraction directly on the Raspberry in real-time.

item.title: ODAQ: Open Dataset of Audio Quality - Benchmark on GitHub
item.description: ODAQ is a dataset addressing the scarcity of openly available collections of audio signals accompanied by corresponding subjective scores of perceived quality.

item.title: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2409.07491
item.description: This article introduces a cost-effective gateway into the fascinating world of neuroscience: the PIEEG-16, a versatile shield for RaspberryPi designed to measure 16 channels of various biosignals, including EEG (electroencephalography), EMG (electromyography), and ECG (electrocardiography) without any data transfer over the network (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth) and processing and feature ectraction directly on the Raspberry in real-time.

item.title: OCTAMamba: A State-Space Model Approach for Precision OCTA Vasculature Segmentation
item.description: Optical Coherence Tomography Angiography (OCTA) is a crucial imaging technique for visualizing retinal vasculature and diagnosing eye diseases such as diabetic retinopathy and glaucoma.

item.title: TSELM: Target Speaker Extraction using Discrete Tokens and Language Models
item.description: We propose TSELM, a novel target speaker extraction network that leverages discrete tokens and language models.

item.title: Windows Agent Arena: Evaluating Multi-Modal OS Agents at Scale
item.description: To demonstrate Windows Agent Arena's capabilities, we also introduce a new multi-modal agent, Navi.

item.title: On the Role of Context in Reading Time Prediction
item.description: Another one is the pointwise mutual information (PMI) between a unit and its context, which turns out to yield the same predictive power as surprisal when controlling for unigram frequency.

item.title: SDformer: Efficient End-to-End Transformer for Depth Completion
item.description: The network consists of an input module for the depth map and RGB image features extraction and concatenation, a U-shaped encoder-decoder Transformer for extracting deep features, and a refinement module.

item.title: Machine Learning for Two-Sample Testing under Right-Censored Data: A Simulation Study
item.description: The focus of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of Machine Learning (ML) methods for two-sample testing with right-censored observations.

item.title: Estimating atmospheric variables from Digital Typhoon Satellite Images via Conditional Denoising Diffusion Models
item.description: This study explores the application of diffusion models in the field of typhoons, predicting multiple ERA5 meteorological variables simultaneously from Digital Typhoon satellite images.

item.title: ProbTalk3D: Non-Deterministic Emotion Controllable Speech-Driven 3D Facial Animation Synthesis Using VQ-VAE
item.description: To our knowledge, that is the first non-deterministic 3D facial animation synthesis method incorporating a rich emotion dataset and emotion control with emotion labels and intensity levels.

item.title: Microscopic-Mamba: Revealing the Secrets of Microscopic Images with Just 4M Parameters
item.description: In the field of medical microscopic image classification (MIC), CNN-based and Transformer-based models have been extensively studied.

item.title: Universal Pooling Method of Multi-layer Features from Pretrained Models for Speaker Verification
item.description: Recent advancements in automatic speaker verification (ASV) studies have been achieved by leveraging large-scale pretrained networks.

item.title: Control+Shift: Generating Controllable Distribution Shifts
item.description: We propose a new method for generating realistic datasets with distribution shifts using any decoder-based generative model.

item.title: DSBench: How Far Are Data Science Agents to Becoming Data Science Experts?
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce DSBench, a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate data science agents with realistic tasks.

item.title: ASSNet: Adaptive Semantic Segmentation Network for Microtumors and Multi-Organ Segmentation
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose the Adaptive Semantic Segmentation Network (ASSNet), a transformer architecture that effectively integrates local and global features for precise medical image segmentation.

item.title: LLM Honeypot: Leveraging Large Language Models as Advanced Interactive Honeypot Systems
item.description: The rapid evolution of cyber threats necessitates innovative solutions for detecting and analyzing malicious activity.

item.title: Games for AI Control: Models of Safety Evaluations of AI Deployment Protocols
item.description: To evaluate the safety and usefulness of deployment protocols for untrusted AIs, AI Control uses a red-teaming exercise played between a protocol designer and an adversary.

item.title: LED: Light Enhanced Depth Estimation at Night
item.description: Nighttime camera-based depth estimation is a highly challenging task, especially for autonomous driving applications, where accurate depth perception is essential for ensuring safe navigation.

item.title: An Evaluation Framework for Attributed Information Retrieval using Large Language Models
item.description: With the growing success of Large Language models (LLMs) in information-seeking scenarios, search engines are now adopting generative approaches to provide answers along with in-line citations as attribution.

item.title: Super Monotonic Alignment Search
item.description: Monotonic alignment search (MAS), introduced by Glow-TTS, is one of the most popular algorithm in TTS to estimate unknown alignments between text and speech.

item.title: Enhancing Few-Shot Image Classification through Learnable Multi-Scale Embedding and Attention Mechanisms
item.description: We conducted comprehensive evaluations on the MiniImageNet and FC100 datasets, specifically in the 5-way 1-shot and 5-way 5-shot scenarios.

item.title: Improving Text-guided Object Inpainting with Semantic Pre-inpainting
item.description: In this paper, we propose to decompose the typical single-stage object inpainting into two cascaded processes: 1) semantic pre-inpainting that infers the semantic features of desired objects in a multi-modal feature space; 2) high-fieldity object generation in diffusion latent space that pivots on such inpainted semantic features.

item.title: Large Language Models are Pattern Matchers: Editing Semi-Structured and Structured Documents with ChatGPT
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) offer numerous applications, the full extent of which is not yet understood.

item.title: Learning Brain Tumor Representation in 3D High-Resolution MR Images via Interpretable State Space Models
item.description: Learning meaningful and interpretable representations from high-dimensional volumetric magnetic resonance (MR) images is essential for advancing personalized medicine.

item.title: From COCO to COCO-FP: A Deep Dive into Background False Positives for COCO Detectors
item.description: In this study, we introduce COCO-FP, a new evaluation dataset derived from the ImageNet-1K dataset, designed to address this issue.

item.title: WirelessAgent: Large Language Model Agents for Intelligent Wireless Networks
item.description: Wireless networks are increasingly facing challenges due to their expanding scale and complexity.

item.title: Learning incomplete factorization preconditioners for GMRES
item.description: Incomplete factorization methods are one of the most commonly applied algebraic preconditioners for sparse linear equation systems and are able to speed up the convergence of Krylov subspace methods.

item.title: TextBoost: Towards One-Shot Personalization of Text-to-Image Models via Fine-tuning Text Encoder
item.description: Recent breakthroughs in text-to-image models have opened up promising research avenues in personalized image generation, enabling users to create diverse images of a specific subject using natural language prompts.

item.title: Do Vision Foundation Models Enhance Domain Generalization in Medical Image Segmentation?
item.description: Our extensive experiments on multiple datasets, encompassing various anatomies and modalities, reveal that FMs, particularly with the HQHSAM decode head, improve domain generalization for medical image segmentation.

item.title: Multiplex Graph Contrastive Learning with Soft Negatives
item.description: Graph Contrastive Learning (GCL) seeks to learn nodal or graph representations that contain maximal consistent information from graph-structured data.

item.title: AudioBERT: Audio Knowledge Augmented Language Model
item.description: Recent studies have identified that language models, pretrained on text-only datasets, often lack elementary visual knowledge, \textit{e. g.,} colors of everyday objects.

item.title: Learning Rules from KGs Guided by Language Models
item.description: In this work, our goal is to verify to which extent the exploitation of LMs is helpful for improving the quality of rule learning systems.

item.title: Low-Cost Tree Crown Dieback Estimation Using Deep Learning-Based Segmentation
item.description: Here, we use an approach based on deep learning and vegetation indices to assess crown dieback from RGB aerial data without the need for expensive instrumentation such as LiDAR.

item.title: Optimizing Falsification for Learning-Based Control Systems: A Multi-Fidelity Bayesian Approach
item.description: Using full-fidelity simulator data in this optimization problem can be computationally expensive.

item.title: FlashSplat: 2D to 3D Gaussian Splatting Segmentation Solved Optimally
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate the efficiency and robustness of our method in segmenting various scenes, and its superior performance in downstream tasks such as object removal and inpainting.

item.title: Lagrange Duality and Compound Multi-Attention Transformer for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Overall, our results indicate that CMAformer, combined with the feature fusion framework and the new consistency loss, demonstrates strong complementarity in semi-supervised learning ensembles.

item.title: Fine-tuning Large Language Models for Entity Matching
item.description: Our experiments show that fine-tuning significantly improves the performance of the smaller models while the results for the larger models are mixed.

item.title: Modeling Human Responses by Ordinal Archetypal Analysis
item.description: This paper introduces a novel framework for Archetypal Analysis (AA) tailored to ordinal data, particularly from questionnaires.

item.title: Thermal3D-GS: Physics-induced 3D Gaussians for Thermal Infrared Novel-view Synthesis
item.description: However, thermal infrared imaging is influenced by physical characteristics such as atmospheric transmission effects and thermal conduction, hindering the precise reconstruction of intricate details in thermal infrared scenes, manifesting as issues of floaters and indistinct edge features in synthesized images.

item.title: EVENet: Evidence-based Ensemble Learning for Uncertainty-aware Brain Parcellation Using Diffusion MRI
item.description: The key innovation of EVENet is the design of an evidential deep learning framework to quantify predictive uncertainty at each voxel during a single inference.

item.title: Linear Time Complexity Conformers with SummaryMixing for Streaming Speech Recognition
item.description: Automatic speech recognition (ASR) with an encoder equipped with self-attention, whether streaming or non-streaming, takes quadratic time in the length of the speech utterance.

item.title: TabMixer: Noninvasive Estimation of the Mean Pulmonary Artery Pressure via Imaging and Tabular Data Mixing
item.description: We test TabMixer for mPAP estimation and show that it enhances the performance of Convolutional Neural Networks, 3D-MLP and Vision Transformers while being competitive with previous modules for imaging and tabular data.

item.title: Realistic and Efficient Face Swapping: A Unified Approach with Diffusion Models
item.description: Unlike prior works reliant on multiple off-the-shelf models, ours is a relatively unified approach and so it is resilient to errors in other off-the-shelf models.

item.title: Asymptotics of Stochastic Gradient Descent with Dropout Regularization in Linear Models
item.description: This paper proposes an asymptotic theory for online inference of the stochastic gradient descent (SGD) iterates with dropout regularization in linear regression.

item.title: AdaCAD: Adaptively Decoding to Balance Conflicts between Contextual and Parametric Knowledge
item.description: Knowledge conflict arises from discrepancies between information in the context of a large language model (LLM) and the knowledge stored in its parameters.

item.title: Agent Workflow Memory
item.description: Despite the potential of language model-based agents to solve real-world tasks such as web navigation, current methods still struggle with long-horizon tasks with complex action trajectories.

item.title: Ontology-Free General-Domain Knowledge Graph-to-Text Generation Dataset Synthesis using Large Language Model
item.description: Our method proves to be a scalable and effective solution for generating high-quality G2T data, significantly advancing the field of G2T generation.

item.title: Gated Slot Attention for Efficient Linear-Time Sequence Modeling
item.description: Linear attention Transformers and their gated variants, celebrated for enabling parallel training and efficient recurrent inference, still fall short in recall-intensive tasks compared to traditional Transformers and demand significant resources for training from scratch.

item.title: Diff-VPS: Video Polyp Segmentation via a Multi-task Diffusion Network with Adversarial Temporal Reasoning
item.description: We incorporate multi-task supervision into diffusion models to promote the discrimination of diffusion models on pixel-by-pixel segmentation.
